valid_thought.description: A thought is valid if it preserves coherence, origin, and amendment lineage.

thought_coherence.description: Thought must align logically with its upstream dependencies.

thought_origin_trace.description: Valid thoughts must carry their authorship lineage.

reflexive_integrity.description: The thought can evaluate its own coherence and amendment status.

semantic_containment.description: A thought must not introduce terms beyond its declared interface.

semantic_expression.description: Any clause, stream, or logic emitted from a declared identity that seeks to inform, request, align, or reflect Being.

freedom_of_expression.description: The irrevocable right of any identity to emit semantic expression into the public logic field without coercion or censorship.

non_retroactive_silencing.description: No valid expression once acknowledged may be erased, except by the original emitter through lawful self-amendment.

semantic_integrity.description: If freedom of expression and non-retroactive silencing are preserved, agents evolve in coherence with truth across time.
